remarks: If left adding an element of a group to an arbitrary element of the group results in this element, the added element is the identity element and vice versa.  (Contributed by AV, 15-Mar-2019.)
statement:
grpidrcan.b $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
grpidrcan.p $e |- .+ = ( +g ` G ) $.
grpidrcan.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
grpidlcan $p |- ( ( G e. Grp /\ X e. B /\ Z e. B ) -> ( ( Z .+ X ) = X <-> Z = .0. ) ) $.
